alert.note: Alert for Inland Worcester; Somerset (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 6:24PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Somerset, southwestern Worcester and northern Accomack Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 623 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Lawsonia, or 18 miles west of Pocomoke City, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Pocomoke City, Lawsonia, Marion Station, West Pocomoke, Bloxom, Saxis, Hallwood, Mappsville, Byrdtown, Fairmount, Hopewell, Rehobeth, Kingston, Temperanceville, Nelsonia, Shelltown, Sanford, Upper Fairmount, Oak Hall and Guilford. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
